intro: Sphenomeris decomposita, commonly known as the decomposed sphenomeris, is a rare and specialized plant species. It is a member of the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are dissected and pinnatifid, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species in many regions.
